standard_metadata.standard_description: Understand a rational number as a point on the number line. Extend number line diagrams and coordinate axes familiar from previous grades to represent points on the line and in the plane with negative number coordinates.

question.content: Point $A$ is graphed on the coordinate plane.    **Which ordered pair represents point $A$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled A is 7 units to the left of and 7 units up from the origin.

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.
Let's locate the point by starting at the $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$.   [[☃ image 3]]  The point is to the $\maroonD{\text{left}}$ and $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the origin.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled A is 7 units to the left of and 7 units up from the origin.  A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect.

hints.content: The first coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis, or $\maroonD{x}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $A$ is $\maroonD{7}$ units to the $\maroonD{\text{left}}$ of the origin. So, its $\maroonD{x}$-coordinate is $\maroonD{-7}$.  $(\maroonD{-7}, \tealE{y})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled A is 7 units to the left of and 7 units up from the origin.  A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 7 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The second coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis, or $\tealE{y}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $A$ is $\tealE{7}$ units $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the $x$-axis. So, its $\tealE{y}$-coordinate is $\tealE{7}$.  $(\maroonD{-7}, \tealE{7})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled A is 7 units to the left of and 7 units up from the origin.  A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 7 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the seventh tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 7 on the y axis.

hints.content: $(-7, 7)$ represents point $A$.

question.content: Point $B$ is graphed on the coordinate plane.    **Which ordered pair represents point $B$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled B is 4 units to the left of and 0 units up from the origin.

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.
Let's locate the point by starting at the $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$.   [[☃ image 2]]  The point is to the $\maroonD{\text{left}}$ of the origin.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled B is 4 units to the left of and 0 units up from the origin. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect.

hints.content: The first coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis, or $\maroonD{x}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $B$ is $\maroonD{4}$ units to the $\maroonD{\text{left}}$ of the origin. So, its $\maroonD{x}$-coordinate is $\maroonD{-4}$.  $(\maroonD{-4}, \tealE{y})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled B is 4 units to the left of and 0 units up from the origin.  A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The second coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis, or $\tealE{y}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $B$ is $\tealE{\text{on}}$ the $x$-axis. It is neither above nor below the $x$-axis. So, its $\tealE{y}$-coordinate is $\tealE{0}$.  $(\maroonD{-4}, \tealE{0})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled B is 4 units to the left of and 0 units up from the origin.  A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: $(-4, 0)$ represents point $B$.

question.content: Point $C$ is graphed on the coordinate plane.    **Which ordered pair represents point $C$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled C is 6 units to the right of and 5 units down from the origin.

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.
Let's locate the point by starting at the $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$.   [[☃ image 2]]  The point is to the $\maroonD{\text{right}}$ and $\tealE{\text{below}}$ the origin.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled C is 6 units to the right of and 5 units down from the origin. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect.

hints.content: The first coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis, or $\maroonD{x}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $C$ is $\maroonD{6}$ units to the $\maroonD{\text{right}}$ of the origin. So, its $\maroonD{x}$-coordinate is $\maroonD{6}$.  $(\maroonD{6}, \tealE{y})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled C is 6 units to the right of and 5 units down from the origin. A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 6 ticks to the  right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The second coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis, or $\tealE{y}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $C$ is $\tealE{5}$ units $\tealE{\text{below}}$ the $x$-axis. So, its $\tealE{y}$-coordinate is $\tealE{-5}$.  $(\maroonD{6}, \tealE{-5})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled C is 6 units to the right of and 5 units down from the origin. A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 6 ticks to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves down from the sixth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number negative 5 on the y axis.

hints.content: $(6, -5)$ represents point $C$.

A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 1 tick to the right from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The second coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis, or $\tealE{y}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $F$ is $\tealE{4}$ units $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the $x$-axis. So, its $\tealE{y}$-coordinate is $\tealE{4}$.  $(\maroonD{1}, \tealE{4})$

question.content: Point $G$ is graphed on the coordinate plane.    **Which ordered pair represents point $G$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled G is 4 units to the left of and 1 and 1 half units up from the origin.

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.
Let's locate the point by starting at the $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$.   [[☃ image 2]]  The point is to the $\maroonD{\text{left}}$ and $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the origin.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled G is 4 units to the left of and 1 and 1 half units up from the origin. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect.

hints.content: The first coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis, or $\maroonD{x}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $G$ is $\maroonD{4}$ units to the $\maroonD{\text{left}}$ of the origin. So, its $\maroonD{x}$-coordinate is $\maroonD{-4}$.  $(\maroonD{-4}, \tealE{y})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled G is 4 units to the left of and 1 and 1 half units up from the origin. A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 4 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.

hints.content: The second coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis, or $\tealE{y}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $G$ is $\tealE{1.5}$ units $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the $x$-axis. So, its $\tealE{y}$-coordinate is $\tealE{1.5}$.  $(\maroonD{-4}, \tealE{1.5})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 5 to 5 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled G is 4 units to the left of and 1 and 1 half units up from the origin. A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 4 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis. An arrow moves up from the fourth tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 1 and 1 half on the y axis.

hints.content: $(-4, 1.5)$ represents point $G$.

question.content: Point $H$ is graphed on the coordinate plane.    **Which ordered pair represents point $H$?**

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled H is 0 units to the left of and 6 units up from the origin.

hints.content: An ordered pair $(\maroonD{x}, \tealE{y})$ gives the location of a point on the coordinate plane.  $\maroonD{x}$ describes where the point is along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis.  $\tealE{y}$ describes where the point is along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis.
Let's locate the point by starting at the $\blueE{\text{origin}}$, $(0, 0)$.   [[☃ image 2]]  The point is  $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the origin.

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled H is 0 units to the left of and 6 units up from the origin. A solid point labeled origin is plotted where the x and y axis intersect.

hints.content: The first coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\maroonD{\text{horizontal}}$ axis, or $\maroonD{x}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $H$ is $\maroonD{\text{on}}$ the $y$-axis. It is neither left nor right of the origin. So, its $\maroonD{x}$-coordinate is $\maroonD{0}$.  $(\maroonD{0}, \tealE{y})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled H is 0 units to the left of and 6 units up from the origin. A solid point is plotted at the origin.

hints.content: The second coordinate tells us the point's location along the $\tealE{\text{vertical}}$ axis, or $\tealE{y}$-axis.  [[☃ image 1]]  Point $H$ is $\tealE{6}$ units $\tealE{\text{above}}$ the $x$-axis. So, its $\tealE{y}$-coordinate is $\tealE{6}$.  $(\maroonD{0}, \tealE{6})$

images.alt: A coordinate grid is labeled from negative 10 to 10 from the origin in both the x and y axis. A solid point labeled H is 0 units to the left of and 6 units up from the origin. A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves up from the first tick mark on the x axis out to a point aligned with the number 6 on the y axis.

hints.content: $(0, 6)$ represents point $H$.

A solid point is plotted at the origin. An arrow moves 4 ticks to the left from the origin out to a point aligned with the number 0 on the y axis.
